result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A. Towsley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Intimidate Witness/Threaten Force, etc., a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both
Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent including Criminal Thinking. AODA/treatment per agent.  No contact w/R.R. or Z.R.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing on Revocation on 8/2/21

10:05 AM Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Defendant Charles A. Towsley in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State and Atty Dolch received and reviewed a copy of the revocation packet.  Atty Dolch makes a correction that DE did have employment.  State states joint recommendation.  Atty Dolch agrees.  State makes argument.  Atty Dolch makes argument.  State believes they are in as much compliance with Chapter 950 as they can be given the original victim being deceased.  DE does not make a statement.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:

WI State Prison for 6 years (2 years Initial Confinement/4 years Extended Supervision), concurrent to Count 4 but consecutive to any other sentence
107 days jail credit  
Outstanding fines/costs to be converted to civil judgment, if not already done
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Count 4:

WI State Prison for 3 years (1 year Initial Confinement/2 years Extended Supervision), concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence
412 days jail credit  
Outstanding fines/costs to be converted to civil judgment, if not already done
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from DOC to Judge Klicko
2 years until 12/19/22

03:00 PM Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin by phone. Agent Rachel Bogdan appears in court by phone.  Review and consider extending probation to pay restitution.  DE was to pay $200/mo. during probation and hasn't done so. State reviews file and makes statement.  Agent Bogdan makes statement.  State requesting 3 years extension.  Court confirms with agent that DE has complied with everything else except for paying restitution.  DE makes statement - not easy to come up with the extra payment every month.  Atty. Eklund makes statement - didn't ask for confinement time, DE agreed to this, victims out, not a good faith effort.   Court finds DE has not made good faith effort to pay restitution and extend probation 2 years.
Probation review hearing on December 8, 2020 at 03:00 pm.
to Br 2

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Michael Albrecht for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke addresses restitution of 14CF312 to $7110.99.  No request to reduce that amount.  1000.00 to R.R. no reduction requested for that amount.  Amount of $16799.23 is being requested for reduction to $6290.00.  Attorney ORourke calls defendant, Charles A. Towsley, sworn & testifies.  Currently on probation, serving conditional jail.  Employment history: current and previous.  Attorney ORourke marked exh 1.  Identified by defendant.  State cross examines defendant re: employment.  Attorney ORourke redirect.  Attorney ORourke argues ability to pay.  No argument on amount payable to individuals.  State argues.  Court grants request of Attorney ORourke.  Modified amount of $6290.00 due to Insurance Co. granted.  Restitution order to be drafted by Attorney ORourke.
